history.text: Hello.  It looks as though we will be chatting about the fantastic movie Zootopia!
Cool! I saw that movie and thought it was really cute.
I agree!  Ginnifer Goodwin as Judy Hopps was just adorable!
Judy was my favorite. The sloth was pretty funny too.
Haha!  That was a great part.  I never knew Jason Bateman was who played the fox.
Huh, I didn't know that was him.
What a great film about looking past stereotypes.
Oh yeah, totally. I thought it sent a really great message to kids.
It taught a great lesson while staying entertaining.
Yeah, it's important to keep that balance. It sent a message without being preachy.
The part where the Otter becomes savage in the limo was a little intense.
True. I didn't see the twist at the end with the sheep-mayor coming.
I didn't either.  She seemed so sweet.  I guess just another lesson on putting people in a certain "box".
Yup. Sometimes things aren't what they seem. I guess in a way she was a "wolf in sheep's clothing."
Who knew a little carrot pen would save the day
Ha, yes!
Bunnyburrow is such a cute name for a town
It is. I'm a sucker for punny/cutesy names in things like this.
Me too.  The little mice mobsters.  lol
I wonder if they'll make a second one. I know it was really popular.
I hope they do.  The ratings were great!
They probably will. It is Disney after all, hehe.
True.  They like to run with themes.
Hopefully Judy Hopps and her Fox friend will remain besties in any sequels.  It's a great message for kids to see people with so many differences be such great friends.
Oh yeah. Didn't he join the squad at the end? That's a perfect jumping off point for a sequel.
Oh ya!  I had forgotten about that! I can't wait to see what happens next.
I liked that he knew her true character and forgave her rather quickly for what she said.
It's been nice chatting with you about the Zootopia movie
Yes, same! Hope you have a good day. ^_^
To you as well.
Hopefully we will hear that a sequel to Zootopia is being made soon.
Yeah, I hope so.

uid1response.feedback: I'm not entirely sure we did the activity correctly? We had both seen the movie and spent the time discussing aspects of it we enjoyed. But FWIW the chat function worked smoothly. Supposing the other user was actually a "bot," it was able to carry on the conversation in a natural and logical way. (I don't know that this is the case, though--perhaps that's not what you're testing, although the name "ConvAI" kind of points to this. ^_^)

uid2response.feedback: Thank you for allowing me to participate.
